评论概述: Don't expect size to be terribly accurate
评论详情: I purchased 5 of these, and every one is a different size by measure. My wife is a seamstress and I asked her to alter them to fit me and as she measured a couple of them she discovered they were quite different.  So she measured all of them and the variation was as much as an inch and a half in the waist and the same in length.  One pair actually measured a half inch off from one leg to the other on the same pair!

My husband is a painter and he loves these double knee painters pants!!  Surprised that the company I have been buying these for years is discontinuing these great painters pants. Still recommend these Dickes are great!!

评论概述: As a union carpenter, I am 100% satisfied with these pants
评论详情: As a union carpenter, I buy the best for apparel and equipment. Dickies and Carhart are my number one choice and these recent dickies that I bought fit perfect are exactly as they are described on Amazon and will be purchasing more of these. I am 100% satisfied with these pants.

Been painting for 15 years and always hoping to find a nice paint pant to wear that actually comfortable and practical. Dickies any version of there paint pants are horrible and false advertised. Not relaxed fit. Not flex stretch. You can see right through them so your customer will know what underwear you have on. Horrible pants. Like wearing cardboard drop cloths. Duluth made a great pant but stopped unfortunately.

Great work pants. Lots of pockets and, at the price point, you're not afraid to get them dirty. A little tight though; I think they're sized a tad small, so I ordered the next size up from my usual waist size. Be aware of this. The return policy is efficient, so if the size is wrong, exchange them.
Excellent, I love the fold for knee pads.
I liked the pants.

The only reason I am not giving 5 out of 5 stars is because the knee pads which were a pleasant surprise would have been even better had they been able to be inserted through the top. The way they are inserted causes them to fall out of place. Still, I hate to complain about what I can only describe as a bonus.

Painters pants, perfect fit! All the utility pockets you need!

I ordered these pants because I grew up wearing carpenter jeans, Smith’s. Unfortunately, Smith’s no longer makes them in white… So I tried Dickies. They are THEE most stiff and uncomfortable pants I’ve ever purchased. Like putting on a pair of pants made of sheet rock! I have soaked them in Epsom salts. I have washed them repeatedly, in  fabric softener. Nothing works. They are hard as a rock! And utterly unbending. If you work in construction, maybe this is what you want? But if you’re just looking to purchase a pair of pants to wear casually, nostalgic of your teenage years in the 1970s… do not buy these! Horrible! I bought a 34 waist by 32 length. 34 waist in men’s pants usually fit me very loosely. Carpenter pants are not supposed to be snug. They are supposed to slouch loosely lower around your hips. I can barely button  the waist line, and it sits above the belly button. WORST  PANTS  EVER!

The 8.75 oz. material is so light weight, its nearly see through-lol These are supposed to be Work-Wear ? Double Knee or not, these things will be lucky to withstand one week on a jobsite.  Dickies used to be a reliable brand, 1-rung underneath Carhartt. But now they've joined the crowd by producing disposable products with a very short lifespan.  In all honesty, the Mfg. should be ashamed to produce a product purposed for utility work so cheaply.  I think ill put them away for summer time & wear them to the Beach-lol
